intro: Mystacidium clavatum, commonly known as the club-shaped liverwort, is a member of the family Porellaceae. It is a non-vascular plant that thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in temperate regions. The plant has a thalloid structure with a prostrate stem and leaf-like structures called phyllidia. Its reproductive structures, known as sporophytes, are borne on short stalks and produce spores. Mystacidium clavatum plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for microorganisms in its ecological niche.
